Try the [Osher Lifelong Learning Institute](http://www. olliatutep. org/home. html) at UTEP.  I don't think enough people know about this program. The classes are free or at an extra low cost. My mother-in-law LOVES the one she goes to in California. She attends the Shakespeare and play-reading classes and has lots of friends. She hangs out with some of her fellow students after class- I think they go to a Panera for coffee and there[.] at least one other student she[.] always going to plays with. I only mention it because I imagine that[.] the kind of social life your mom could have if she started going to the senior classes they offer here.
 
I was looking at the website for the senior college here and they have some art and literature classes. Since she[.] a crafter, maybe she'd like some of the arts classes. You'll probably find Spanish speakers in the repujado class (punched tin pieces, $20 for 12 sessions on Mondays).  There[.] also a Don Quijote class if she likes to read and another one that sounds like its about the history of Mexico in this and previous centuries.

Alternatively, if she[.] into being artistic I am teaching two classes at the end of the month. I come home to El Paso periodically for family reasons.  While I'm here I teach art classes. I'm actually in a Starbucks in the Northeast working on the fliers I'm gonna post around town.

The afternoon class is covers portraiture, Mon-Fri (May 26-30) from 1-4pm. It[.] an advanced class, so far the students are mainly English speakers but I speak Spanish. $75 for the week.

And the evening class covers drawing from live models, Mon-Fri (May 26-30) from 7-10pm. $10 a session.  This class if more for beginners and about half the people who came to my last workshop were Spanish speakers.
